desc: Inhibin alpha (INHA) encodes for the alpha subunit of inhibin A and B protein complex which negatively regulates FSH secretion and negatively regulates gonadal stroma cell proliferation (PMID: 3086749, 6769050, 3092356). Inhibin also regulates erythroid differentiation and placenta development (PMID: 3696240, 3299703). Inhibin has tumor suppressive functions in the gonades, as inhibin loss in gonadal tissue leads to tumor formation (PMID: 1448148). Certain single-nucleotide polymorphisms in INHA are associated with an increased risk of testicular germ cell tumors (PMID: 18413775).
articles/0/title: Pituitary FSH is released by a heterodimer of the beta-subunits from the two forms of inhibin.
articles/1/title: Inhibin is absent from azoospermic semen of infertile men.
articles/2/title: Inhibin-mediated feedback control of follicle-stimulating hormone secretion in the female rat.
articles/3/title: Importance of FSH-releasing protein and inhibin in erythrodifferentiation.
articles/4/title: Genetic variation in the inhibin pathway and risk of testicular germ cell tumors.
articles/5/title: Alpha-inhibin is a tumour-suppressor gene with gonadal specificity in mice.
articles/6/title: Localization, secretion, and action of inhibin in human placenta.

desc: INHA is a negative regulator of FSH and acts as a tumor suppressor in gonadal tumors.
